column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=1 .
#Text=Introduction
#Text=Infectious hematopoietic necrosis virus ( IHNV ) , one of the most devastating fish pathogens , causes considerable economic losses to the aquaculture industry .
#Text=The virus is a single-stranded , bullet-shaped , ribonucleic acid ( RNA ) virus that belongs to the genus Norvirhabdovirus and the family Rhabdoviridae .
#Text=The virus was first reported in the 1950s in sockeye salmon ( Oncorhynchus nerka ) from Washington and Oregon fish hatcheries in the United States .
#Text=Diverse fish species are known to be susceptible to IHNV infections including salmonids , which are the most vulnerable .
#Text=The pathogenicity of the virus is known to depend on environmental conditions and the size and species of the fish .

#Text=Outbreaks of IHNV infection are usually associated with a mortality rate of 50 – 60 % , but can be up to 95 % , and younger fish have been found to be more susceptible to the clinical symptoms and acute infections .
#Text=The virus was first reported in Asian countries in 1971 when diseased kokanee salmon ( freshwater O. nerka ) were imported to Japan from North America .

#Text=Although the consumption amount of salmonids and the size of the fisheries rearing this species in Korea are relatively smaller than those in other countries in Europe and North America , some previous studies have been conducted on the presence of IHNV in Korea .
#Text=In 1991 , the first outbreak of IHNV was reported in Korea in cultured rainbow trout ( Oncorhynchus mykiss ) and masuo salmon ( Oncorhynchus masuo ) .

#Text=The IHNV genome consists of six genes in the order 3’-N-P-M-G-NV-L-5 ’ , representing the nucleocapsid protein ( N ) , phosphoprotein ( P ) , matrix gene ( M ) , glycoprotein ( G ) , nonvirion protein ( NV ) , and polymerase protein ( L ) .
#Text=The size of the genome was approximately 11 kb , and studies analyzing the genome , phylogenesis , and diversity of IHNV have usually used the G , N , and NV genes .
#Text=Further , epidemiologic studies , including phylogenetic analyses of IHNV isolated from different countries worldwide , have identified five genogroups to date .

#Text=The presence of genogroups U , M , and L was reported in North America based on studies of isolates collected from genographic areas in the Pacific Northwest of North America including Alaska , British Columbia , the Columbia River basin , and Idaho .
#Text=Moreover , the genogroup L was observed in isolates from California and the southern Oregon coast .
#Text=The remaining two genogroups are the E and J genogroups .
#Text=The lineage of the E genogroup is European , and it is divided into two subgroups : E1 and E2 .
#Text=The J genogroup represents isolates from Japan and South Korea and is also divided into two subclades : J Nagano ( JN ) and J Shizuoka ( JS ) .

#Text=In addition , a recent study phylogenetically analyzing Chinese isolates based on the G gene reported that Chinese IHNV isolates form another individual clade belonging to the J genogroup with Asian lineage .

#Text=IHNV is one of the most well-known viruses that cause significantly high mortality rates in rainbow trout fisheries , and recent research indicates that reports on IHNV infections are increasing , especially in almost all geographic regions of China .
#Text=Moreover , compared to before 2000 , the number of IHNV isolates has gradually increased in Korea recently .

#Text=No study has reported the complete genome sequence of the IHNV isolates in Korea , and the quality of data associated with the phylogenetic analysis of the Korean IHNV isolates is poor compared with that of the data of studies conducted in other countries .
#Text=Therefore , our study aimed to provide sufficient information on the phylogenetics of IHNV isolates from Korea .
#Text=Further , to the best of our knowledge , this is first study to report the complete genomic sequence of the IHNV strain isolated from Korea .

#Text=In addition , we also aimed to study the nucleotide substitution and phylogenetic patterns of IHNV isolated from Korea and compared them to those of other isolates from Asia , Europe , and North America .
